items.title: NASA Invites Media to Boeing Orbital Flight Test Launch for Commercial Crew
items.description: Media accreditation is open for Boeing’s uncrewed Orbital Flight Test (OFT) to the International Space Station, as part of NASA’s Commercial Crew Program.

items.title: NASA Invites Media to Next SpaceX Space Station Cargo Launch
items.description: Media accreditation is open for the launch of the next SpaceX delivery of science investigations, supplies, and equipment to the International Space Station.

items.title: NASA Administrator Invites Public to Update on Agency’s Return to Moon
items.description: The public is invited to join NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine at 9:40 a.m. EDT Friday, Oct. 25, for an update on the agency’s Artemis program and the critical role international partnerships have in returning astronauts to the Moon and going on to Mars.

items.title: Maryland, Washington Students to Speak with NASA Astronaut Aboard Space Station
items.description: Students from Maryland and Washington, D.C., will have an opportunity this week to talk with a NASA astronaut currently living and working aboard the International Space Station.

items.title: NASA Invites Media to Boeing Starliner Transport to Launch Site
items.description: Media accreditation is open for two-days of activities in mid-November for the next milestone in NASA’s Commercial Crew Program, as Boeing’s CST-100 Starliner is transported for integration on a United Launch Alliance (ULA) Atlas V rocket.

items.title: NASA to Provide Coverage of Key Events at 70th International Astronautical Congress
items.description: NASA will provide live coverage on NASA Television of key events at the 70th International Astronautical Congress (IAC), which takes place Oct. 21-25 at the Walter E. Washington Convention Center in Washington.

items.title: In-Space News Conference to Review First All-Woman Spacewalk
items.description: NASA astronauts Christina Koch and Jessica Meir will participate in a news conference from orbit at noon EDT, Monday, Oct. 21, following their Friday spacewalk – the first to be conducted by two women.

items.title: NASA’s Planetary Protection Review Addresses Changing Reality of Space Exploration
items.description: NASA released a report Friday with recommendations from the Planetary Protection Independent Review Board (PPIRB) the agency established in response to a recent National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine report and a recommendation from the NASA Advisory Council.

items.title: NASA to Televise First All-Female Spacewalk, Host Media Teleconference
items.description: On the first ever all-female spacewalk, NASA astronauts Christina Koch and Jessica Meir will venture outside the International Space Station about 7:50 a.m. EDT Friday, Oct. 18, to replace faulty equipment on the station’s exterior. Live coverage will begin at 6:30 a.m. on NASA Television and the agency’s website.

items.title: NASA Invites Media to Launch of Solar Orbiter Spacecraft
items.description: NASA has opened media accreditation for the Feb. 5, 2020, launch of Solar Orbiter – a joint NASA/ESA (European Space Agency) mission that will address central questions concerning our star, the Sun.

title: NASA Breaking News
description: A RSS news feed containing the latest NASA news articles and press releases.
